sentence.text: Interestingly, de novo loss-of-function and missense variants in histone H3-K4 demethylation were identified in patients with intellectual disability (ID) and autism spectrum disorder (ASD) but also in unaffected individuals.

The c.808 + 1G AAAA A variant was identified in a boy with mild ID and autism negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and is associated with a significant reduced histone H3-K4 demethylation mRNA expression without alteration of its H3K4me3 pattern.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Our data reinforces the recent observation that the histone H3-K4 demethylation haploinsufficiency is not a mechanism involved in intellectual disability and that KDM5B disorder associated with LOF variants is a recessive disorder.
